intro: Lapsana pubescens, commonly known as hairy false dandelion, is a herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm and features basal leaves that are hairy and lobed. Its flowers are yellow and bloom in late spring to early summer, followed by spherical seed heads that resemble those of dandelions. Lapsana pubescens is often found in meadows, roadsides, and disturbed soils, and it is considered an invasive species in some regions.
